c74object.name: ossia.attribute
c74object.description: ossia.attribute allows to get or set a parameter's attribute remotely

inlet.name: Value input
inlet.digest: Get or set a parameter attribute
inlet.description: Get or set a parameter attribute

objarg.name: node-name
objarg.description: ossia.attribute requires an argument defining a parameter name to bind to

method.name: address
method.description: The message address followed by a symbol sets the name of the node. This temporary replaces the name provided initially as an argument to the object and allows to address nodes dynamically. Without any argument, address message will set the node address back to as defined as argument to the object.

method.name: get
method.digest: Get the remote parameter attribute value
method.description:
The get message followed by a parameter attribute name will ask the parameter ossia.attribute currently bind its request attribute value and output the result at its outlet. Possible get arguments are:
clip
default
description
enable
hidden
max
min
mode
mute
type
unit
priority
range
rate
repetitions
tags

method.name: select
method.description:
The message select followed by a symbol specifying a node address or address pattern, select one or many addresses within the addresses matched by the pattern set as argument to the object. This can be useful for example to send value only to one or several addresses of the one matched by the pattern defined as argument to the object box.
Note that contrary to the address message which destroys and recreates the namespace as needed to set the remote address, select only scan through the addresses already matched by the remote and is thus much faster.

method.name: send
method.digest: Send value to a particular parameter instance
method.description: When using addresses pattern in ossia.parameter such as 'my_spat/source.{1..3}/gain', the send message followed by a node address and value (ie send my_spat/source.2/gain 0.5) send the value of that particular parameter instance

attribute.name: clip
attribute.digest: Set how bound parameter values exceeding range will be clipped
attribute.description:
The clip attribute defines how values exceeding the bound parameter range will be managed. Available clipmodes are:
free: when set to free (default), exceeding values will be left untouched
low: when set to low, values exceeding the lower bound will be clipped. Values exceeding the upper bound will be left untouched
high: when set to high, values exceeding the upper bound will be clipped. Values exceeding the lower bound will be left untouched
both: when set to both, values exceeding lower or upper bounds will be clipped
wrap: when set to wrap, values exceeding lower or upper bound will wrapped around the opposite bound
fold: when set to fold, values exceeding lower or upper bound will folded back within the defined range

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The default attribute sets the bound parameter value to output at the leftmost outlet on model initialization. The default value can be overridden by the default model preset

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description attribute allows to give the bound parameter a textual description. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: enable
attribute.description: The enable attribute allows to enable (default: 1) or disable a bound parameter

attribute.name: hidden
attribute.digest: Hide bound parameter in remote client
attribute.description: The hidden attribute allows a remote client to hide the bound parameter - this can be useful e.g. for "internal" or setup parameters that we don't want to give access to.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The max attribute defines the maximum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range. In the case of Vecnf's and tuples, this can be a list of floats in order to set different maximum values for each Vec/tuple member.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: The min attribute defines the minimum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range. In the case of Vecnf's and tuples, this can be a list of floats in order to set different minimum values for each Vec/tuple member.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.digest: Define access mode of bound parameter : GET, SET, or both (BI)
attribute.description: Defines the way the value of bound ossia.parameter will be accessible : when set at GET, the value can only be retrieved, when at SET, it can only be set, not retrieved, and when at BI, it can be both set and retrieved.

attribute.name: mute
attribute.description: The mute attribute (off by default) allows to prevent the bound parameter from outputting local (i.e. fed from the input) values - Remotely sent values will still come out

attribute.name: type
attribute.description:
The type attribute defines the type of the bound parameter value. Possible types are:
float (default)
int
bool
tuple
symbol
impulse

attribute.name: unit
attribute.digest: Unit used by the bound parameter
attribute.description: The unit attribute defines the unit used by the bound parameter. Values will get output according to this unit.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The priority attribute allows to order how several values from a same hierarchical level can be recalled

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The range attribute defines the expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.

attribute.name: rate
attribute.digest: Determine the interval at which bound parameter values will be set and get
attribute.description: The rate attribute defines at which interval values will be set and get from/to the bound parameter

attribute.name: repetitions
attribute.description: The repetitions attribute defines whether bound parameter identical values will be repeated (on by default)

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags to the bound parameter. This helps documenting the parameter.
